contents.text: Have you ever seen a unicorn?
contents.subtext: Chapter 1: That magical thing behind the forest

contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen next?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
It is a warm summer day when Edith sits on the edge of the lake.

She is sketching a squirrel carrying an acorn. Edith has a big imagination.

Suddenly the squirrel runs away, leaping quickly into the dense forest nearby. 

Her drawing is half finished, so Edith chases the little critter into the dense forest.

AAs Edith runs, the forest gets denser and denser. There are more and more tall trees and bushy bushes. Edith is careful to step over roots and duck under branches. 

Eventually, Edith comes to a clearing in the forest. In the clearing, she sees the most magical thing she has ever seen.

It’s a unicorn!

Almost like a horse, but shimmering white. The unicorn walks gracefully, unaware that he has been spotted.

Edith who stands nearby, frozen with excitement and in awe of her discovery.

Edith is out of breath and sweating a little from running. 

She wants to say "hi" to the wondrous creature, but she is at a loss for words. 

The next thing she does will change her life forever.
Tell me a story. Tell me about an activity that makes you tired but also excited?
contents.subtext: Any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, and swimming.

contents.text: Tell me why you felt excited even though you were tired.
Sometimes, activities can make you feel tired, but they can also make you feel good afterward!

Chapter 2

Unicorn Run
Do you want to know what's going to happen with the Edith?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
Deep in the forest, there is a magnificent unicorn walking gracefully. Edith decides she wants to take a photo of this beautiful creature. She walks carefully and stealthily, trying not to gasp nor whisper a word. Her steps were muted by the thick grass on the forest floor.

Then something unexpected happens.

"Snap!"

Edith steps on a small dry twig and startles the unicorn! The unicorn, surprised and stunned, runs away immediately.
Edith chases the unicorn as fast as she can.
She is sweating and a little out of breath. Her heart is throbbing out of excitement.
This is the first time she had seen a unicorn so magnificent.
Can you tell me a story? Tell me a story about a time when you tried a new kind of activity.
contents.subtext: Any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, and swimming.

contents.text: What good feelings did you have when you did this new physical activity?

You should congratulate yourself when you are doing a new activity!

Being active regularly takes time and you should be proud of every new steps you make.

Chapter 3:

The Shoes
Do you think Edith can chase the unicorn?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
Edith runs further and deeper into the forest, chasing the unicorn that maneuvers at the speed of light.

It isn’t until about a thousand steps that Edith starts to outpace the unicorn.

"Hey Unicorn," says Edith. 

"Don't be scared, all I want is to take a picture with you."

The unicorn pauses and looks at Edith. 

 The unicorn looks upset.
Edith quickly hugs the unicorn and says: "No no don't cry Uni, I am not going to hurt you, I just want to take a photo of you!"

"I am not scared of you. In fact, you look like a very friendly girl," says the unicorn.

"But I lost my flying shoe. Without my flying shoe, I can't hover, fly, nor glide."
"If I can't hover, fly, nor glide; I will be late for my best friend's birthday party," says the Unicorn.

"Oh I can help you with that!" says Edith.

"I'm good at finding lost things!"

"Let's retrace our steps to find your shoe so you can hover, fly, and glide. And you won't be late for your birthday party," says Edith.

As they walk back retracing their steps, they see a glimmering thing floating above a lake.

"That's my shoe," says the Unicorn.

"Your shoe surely is shimmering," says Edith.

"But it's flying above the lake, how do I get it?" asks the Unicorn.

"I can jump to those small rocks in the lake and grab your shoe," says Edith.

Edith jumps carefully on the rocks inside the lake, one by one until she is close enough to grab the floating unicorn shoe.

"I got your shoe!" yells Edith.

The Unicorn claps with his hooves. 

Clap! Clap! Clap! 

He neighs in excitement.
Can you tell me a story about a time when you helped someone to be more physically active?
contents.contentGroupName: Helping Other People to be Healthy

contents.text: Tell me the feelings you had when you knew that you are helping others?
Working together with other people to be active can make exercise more satisfying!
Chapter 4: When will we play again?
Do you think the unicorn can get to the party on time?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
"Thank you... what's your name?" asks the Unicorn.

"My name is Edith," she says.

"Thank you, Edith. You are a real friend," says the Unicorn.

"Now I have to go to my friend’s birthday party."

The white unicorn starts to gallop then soars up high.

But Edith is upset because she doesn’t know when she will get to play with the unicorn again. As the unicorn fly higher and higher, Edith shouts "Can we play again sometime!?"

The unicorn stops going higher and floats mid-air.

"I will bring my friends tomorrow," says the Unicorn.

The unicorn flies off and disappears in the distance.
The next day, Edith waits in the forest where she met the unicorn the day before. At exactly 12 o'clock, something appears upon the sky.

It's the unicorn again. He gallops down and lands on the meadow. 

Next to the unicorn, is a flying rhinoceros with a pair of big wings and a flying penguin with a pair of small wings.

"Edith, this is my friend Mike," says the Unicorn, introducing the rhino. 

"And this is Linus," says the unicorn while pointing to the flying penguin. 

"This is my friend Edith who inspired me to be brave," says the Unicorn to Mike and Linus.
Edith couldn't be any happier to have not only one, but three new friends.
Can you tell me a story? Tell a story about someone you know who inspires you to be physically active.
contents.subtext: Being active means doing any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath. For example, running, playing in the park, dancing, swimming.
contents.contentGroupName: People Who Inspire You to be Healthy

contents.text: How do they inspire you to be more physically active?
Finding inspirations from people around you can help you to be more active.

You have completed this storybook. Your next story is:

"Sally the Salamander and the Boomerang School"
